description: Run FFmpeg commands in the cloud for fast video and audio conversions, edits, and workflows—no local install required. Chain multiple commands efficiently, monitor progress, and fetch results with direct download links and metadata. Clean up output files when finished to control storage.

rendiApiKey.description: Your Rendi API key for FFmpeg cloud processing. Get your API key at https://rendi.dev

tools.name: test_rendi_connection
tools.title: Test Rendi Connection
tools.description: Test connectivity to Rendi FFmpeg API and validate your API key

tools.name: run_ffmpeg_command
tools.title: Run FFmpeg Command
tools.description: Submit a single FFmpeg command for cloud processing. Use {{alias}} placeholders for files (e.g., {{in_1}}, {{out_1}}). Input files must start with 'in_' and be publicly accessible URLs. Output files must start with 'out_'.

input_files.description: Dictionary mapping input aliases to URLs (e.g., {"in_1": "https://example.com/video.mp4"})

output_files.description: Dictionary mapping output aliases to filenames (e.g., {"out_1": "output.mp4"})

tools.name: run_chained_ffmpeg_commands
tools.title: Run Chained FFmpeg Commands
tools.description: Submit multiple sequential FFmpeg commands where outputs from earlier commands can be used as inputs in later commands. This is more efficient than running commands separately. Maximum 10 commands per chain.

input_files.description: Dictionary mapping input aliases to URLs (e.g., {"in_1": "https://example.com/video.mp4"})

output_files.description: Dictionary mapping output aliases to filenames (e.g., {"out_1": "output.mp4", "out_2": "thumbnail.jpg"})

ffmpeg_commands.description: Array of FFmpeg command strings using {{alias}} placeholders

max_command_run_seconds.description: Maximum runtime per command in seconds (default: 300)

tools.name: poll_ffmpeg_command
tools.title: Poll FFmpeg Command
tools.description: Check the status of a previously submitted FFmpeg command (single or chained). Returns current status, processing time, and output files with download URLs when complete.

command_id.description: The command ID returned when the command was submitted

tools.name: delete_command_files
tools.title: Delete Command Files
tools.description: Delete all output files associated with a completed command. This frees up storage space on Rendi's servers. Note: This action cannot be undone.

command_id.description: The command ID of the files to delete
